poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The smack of burning flesh unfurled The stack of sandbags dwindled. How we stank! And that lang swack o watter, Slack-jawed and still in his livery Sank without flotsam. Visitors snack in the engines The sac that fuelled our malice is lanced. Now seduction is stark as a writ. You want someone to sack.
